pkgmetadata.longdescription:
"git-sync" is a tool to keep multiple git repositories up-to-date with their upstream reposito‚Äê ries, and to clone new repositories as they are added to the upstream location.
The updating is done in a manner which preserves your local state, and should not cause conflicts. A "git remote update --prune" is always done; if the user has no uncommitted changes, and the merge would be a fast-forward, the current branch is "git pull"ed, and the diffstat is printed. Otherwise, the state of the repository is shown in a concise manner.
"git-sync" also understands "git-svn" clones, and updates them using the same rules, but using "git svn fetch" and "git svn rebase" instead of "git remote update" and "git pull".
